meanings.definition: The act or process of reconstructing something.
meanings.sent1: The reconstruction of the puzzle took hours to complete.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the reconstruction of the damaged houses began.
meanings.sent3: The reconstruction of the sandcastle was interrupted by a mischievous wave.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a reconstruction project after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The reconstruction of the ancient ruins brought history back to life.

meanings.definition: The rebuilding or reorganization of something.
meanings.sent1: The reconstruction of the city after the earthquake was a massive effort.
meanings.sent2: The reconstruction of the team led to improved performance.
meanings.sent3: The reconstruction of the jumbled closet made finding clothes easier.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence went through a reconstruction process after the setback.
meanings.sent5: The reconstruction of the garden transformed it into a peaceful sanctuary.

meanings.definition: The act of restoring or repairing something.
meanings.sent1: The reconstruction of the old car made it look brand new.
meanings.sent2: The reconstruction of the painting brought out its true colors.
meanings.sent3: The reconstruction of the broken vase turned it into a unique art piece.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a reconstruction of sunshine after the rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The reconstruction of the antique clock made it tick like new.
